The 12-year span from the initial assault to the final sentencing, highlighting the long delays in justice and institutional failure in handling campus sexual violence.

keyTakeAways: The case underscores systemic failure in campus sexual assault cases, where victims often face long delays in prosecution due to institutional reluctance and loss of evidence.
Ian Cleary was extradited from France after being detained on a vagrancy charge, showing how legal systems can track suspects through unrelated legal issues.
Shannon Keeler’s persistent advocacy, including public disclosure in an AP story, played a crucial role in triggering a renewed investigation and eventual prosecution.
Cleary’s guilty plea and admission of remorse, along with his mental health history, influenced the judge to sentence him below state guidelines.
The Facebook message 'So I raped you' sent by Cleary was not a gesture of reconciliation but a re-traumatizing act that reopened wounds for the victim.
Victim advocacy and public awareness can break cycles of impunity in sexual violence cases, especially in educational institutions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Ian Cleary, who sexually assaulted a woman at Gettysburg College in 2013, was sentenced to two to four years in prison in 2025 after being extradited from France. The case highlights systemic failures in prosecuting campus sexual assaults, including lost evidence, long delays in investigation, and institutional reluctance to act. Shannon Keeler, the victim, pursued charges for over a decade, eventually gaining public attention through an Associated Press story in 2021, which led to renewed prosecution. Cleary pleaded guilty and admitted remorse, citing a 12-step program as part of his atonement. Despite this, the Facebook message he sent saying 'So I raped you' re-traumatized Keeler and exposed the lasting impact of sexual violence. The case underscores the urgent need for reform in how institutions respond to sexual assault, especially on college campuses.
title: Man Sentenced for 2013 Campus Sexual Assault After 12-Year Pursuit of Justice
